result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney /s/ PB 01/31/22 - Atty Gary Kryshak appointed, defendant to reimburse (via wage assignment) at $100/month (not to exceed $500, without prior approval of court) first payment to be made on 02/10/22
Pre-trial conference on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:35 PM Defendant Dominick Hi in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant states that he was not eligible for a public defender.
Defendant has the petition paperwork for a court appointed attorney.
Defendant is informed that the Judicial Assistant for Br 3 was out of the office last week and that is why he had not received a call back.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered on behalf of the defendant by the Court.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Initial Appearance set for January 31, 2022 @ 1:30 p.m. in Br 1
No contact with Michael Wilson

1:36 p.m.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian Pfeil appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Pfeil states facts for anticipated charges of 2 Counts of Disorderly Conduct and 2 Counts of Misdemeanor Battery.
Defendant is not eligible for public defender representation.
Atty Soule  does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond. 
Court adopts the  $500 signature bond as requested by the State with conditions as stated on the record. 

Initial Appearance scheduled for:  January 31, 2022  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 1
